claim.statement: Those with names that begin with an A or a number receive more than five times as many complaints with the Better Business Bureau.
claim.hypothesis: Firms that use names beginning with an A or a number will receive more complaints than firms not using names beginning with an A or a number.

access.restrictions: ReferenceUSA requires access through a local library; BBB.org is publicly accessible.

method.description: Data was collected from ReferenceUSA for plumbing firms in Illinois and matched with complaint data from the Better Business Bureau.
steps: Collect list of plumbing firms from ReferenceUSA.
Match firms with complaint data from BBB.org.
Analyze the relationship between firm name and number of complaints.

results.summary: Firms with names beginning with an A or a number receive more complaints.

metadata.original_paper_title: A Business by Any Other Name: Firm Name Choice as a Signal of Firm Quality

analysis.instructions: Run a regression of complaints on firm_a using OLS.
